resources.string: Open the drawer with the operations
Close the drawer with the operations
Only integrating over a single variable is supported.
Only differentiating over a single variable is supported.
Are you sure you want to delete the substitution?
Are you sure you want to delete this formula? This can not be undone.
Are you sure you want to overwrite this formula? This can not be undone.
Unfortunately Math DragOn was unable to evaluate your expression.
Unfortunately Math DragOn was unable to evaluate your expression, a timeout occurred.
Unfortunately Math DragOn was unable to evaluate your expression, the answer contains a number that is too big.
Unfortunately Math DragOn was unable to evaluate your expression, the answer contains a number that is too small.

Mark Kamsma
Arian van Putten
Folkert van Verseveld
Ivor van der Hoog
Bas van Rooij
Glenn Stewart
Tim de Jonge
Math DragOn is open source. The source code is freely available under the LGPLv3 license and can be found at GitHub: https://github.com/Divendo/math-dragon
Do you want to follow the tutorial?
This is the main screen! Here you can enter your equations.
Click here to access the side menu where you will find the functions and operators.
You can also slide from the left edge of the screen to access it. From there you can drag \'n\' drop onto the main screen.
This little box is where you\'ll enter your equations.
Or swipe from the left edge of the screen, to open the side menu.
From there, drag an icon into an empty box to enter it.
If you made a mistake, undo and redo are right here…
Along with completely deleting your equation.
If you want to save an equation, click the star.
If you want to get an answer, exact and approximate answers are here.
These buttons are for quickly differentiating and integrating your equation.
If you want to enter a value for your variables, click here to do that!
Here, you can enter your constants…
Or, click here to enter a variable!
When you\'re done, click here to confirm.
This is the substution tab! Here you can enter values for your variables.
Please click here to add a substitution.
Here, you can choose your variable, and what to enter for it.
Pick a variable from the keyboard…
Click here to edit the value…
And click here to confirm the substitution!
If you no longer need a substitution, keep your finger on it for a while to delete it.
Tap this button load any favorite formulas. Or save your current formula as a favorite so that you can reuse it later.
This is the favourites tab! Here you can save and load formulas you use often.
Type the name of the formula you want to save here…
Then click here to save it to your favourites.
And a new formula will appear here. You can click to load it…
Or click the save button after a formula to overwrite it.
If you no longer need a formula, keep your finger on it for a while to delete it.
